sense.name: Add some (semantic) information to something, possibly at the end.
sense.commentary: Note: NP2 is probably [abstract]; NP2 always contains abstract content, however. Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] APPEND NP2[patient[abstract]]
sense.examples: He appended a glossary to the end of his novel. The Sentate appended capital gains to the budget bill. I need to append some thoughts to that paper I wrote.

sense.name: Physically attach to something.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] APPEND NP2[patient[concrete]] (PP{P NP[location]})
sense.examples: Append a charm to the necklace. He appended a cover to each book. Append the pin to the edge of your lapel.

sense.name: Add in discourse, as a mode of saying.
sense.commentary: Note: Instance generally contains a quotation; instance must contain a [proposition].
sense.examples: "It doesn't really matter," he appended. She appended that she didn't really want to go to school anyway.
